haxel.HxlUtil

type
class

Static Variables

private _seed : Float

Internal random number calculation helpers.

public quadTree : HxlQuadTree

The global quad tree (stored here since it is used primarily by HxlUtil functions). Set this to null to force it to refresh on the next collide.

public quadTreeBounds : HxlRect

This variable stores the dimensions of the root of the quad tree. This is the eligible game collision space.

public quadTreeDivisions : Int

Controls the granularity of the quad tree. Default is 3 (decent performance on large and small worlds).

public roundingError : Float

Static Methods

public ceil(N : Float) : Int

public cloneMap<T>(map : Array<Array<cloneMap.T>>) : Array<Array<cloneMap.T>>

public colorInt(Red : Int, Green : Int, Blue : Int) : Int

public colorRGB(Color : Int) : Array<Int>

public computeVelocity(Velocity : Float, ?Acceleration : Float, ?Drag : Float, ?Max : Float) : Float

parameters
Velocity Any component of velocity (e.g. 20).
Acceleration Rate at which the velocity is changing.
Drag Really kind of a deceleration, this is how much the velocity changes if Acceleration is not set.
Max An absolute value cap for the velocity.
returns
The altered Velocity value.
A tween-like function that takes a starting velocity and some other factors and returns an altered velocity.

public contains<T>(array : Array<contains.T>, element : contains.T) : Bool

public copyMap<T>(srcMap : Array<Array<copyMap.T>>, destMap : Array<Array<copyMap.T>>) : Void

public countTiles(width : Int, height : Int, map : Array<Array<Int>>, tilesToCount : Array<Int>) : Int

public inline distance(src : HxlPoint, dest : HxlPoint) : Float

public floor(N : Float) : Int

public getLine(src : HxlPoint, dest : HxlPoint, ?isBlocking : HxlPoint -> Bool) : Array<HxlPoint>

public getRandomTile<T>(width : Int, height : Int, map : Array<Array<getRandomTile.T>>, tileTypesToGet : Array<getRandomTile.T>) : HxlPoint

public markFieldOfView(position : HxlPoint, radius : Float, map : HxlTilemap, ?radial : Bool) : Void

public mutate(Seed : Float, Mutator : Float) : Float

parameters
Seed The number to mutate.
Mutator The value to use in the mutation.
returns
A predictably-altered version of the Seed.
Mutates a seed or other number, useful when combined with randomize().

public overlap(Object1 : HxlObject, Object2 : HxlObject, ?Callback : Dynamic) : Bool

parameters
Object1 The first object or group you want to check.
Object2 The second object or group you want to check. If it is the same as the first, flixel knows to just do a comparison within that group.
Callback A function with two HxlObject parameters - e.g. myOverlapFunction(Object1:HxlObject,Object2:HxlObject); If no function is provided, HxlQuadTree will call kill() on both objects.
Call this function to see if one HxlObject overlaps another. Can be called with one object and one group, or two groups, or two objects, whatever floats your boat! It will put everything into a quad tree and then check for overlaps. For maximum performance try bundling a lot of objects together using a HxlGroup (even bundling groups together!) NOTE: does NOT take objects' scrollfactor into account.

public random(?UseGlobalSeed : Bool) : Float

parameters
UseGlobalSeed Whether or not to use the stored HxlUtil.seed value to calculate it.
returns
A pseudo-random Number object.
Generate a pseudo-random number.

public randomInt(max : Int) : Int

public randomize(Seed : Float) : Float

parameters
Seed The number to use to generate a new random value.
returns
A pseudo-random Number object.
Generate a pseudo-random number.

public repalceAllTiles(width : Int, height : Int, map : Array<Array<Int>>, tileToReplace : Int, replacement : Int) : Void

public rotatePoint(X : Float, Y : Float, PivotX : Float, PivotY : Float, Angle : Float, ?P : HxlPoint) : HxlPoint

parameters
X The X coordinate of the point you want to rotate.
Y The Y coordinate of the point you want to rotate.
PivotX The X coordinate of the point you want to rotate around.
PivotY The Y coordinate of the point you want to rotate around.
Angle Rotate the point by this many degrees.
P Optional HxlPoint to store the results in.
returns
A HxlPoint containing the coordinates of the rotated point.
Rotates a point in 2D space around another point by the given angle.

public setWorldBounds(?X : Float, ?Y : Float, ?Width : Float, ?Height : Float, ?Divisions : Int) : Void

parameters
X The X-coordinate of the left side of the game world.
Y The Y-coordinate of the top of the game world.
Width Desired width of the game world.
Height Desired height of the game world.
Divisions Pass a non-zero value to set quadTreeDivisions. Default value is 3.
Call this function to specify a more efficient boundary for your game world. This boundary is used by overlap() and collide(), so it can't hurt to have it be the right size! Flixel will invent a size for you, but it's pretty huge - 256x the size of the screen, whatever that may be. Leave width and height empty if you want to just update the game world's position.

public travrseLine(src : HxlPoint, dest : HxlPoint, ?isBlocking : HxlPoint -> Bool, apply : HxlPoint -> Void, ?maxDist : Float) : Void
